verses.text: Blessed[H835] is the man[H376] that walketh[H1980] not in the counsel[H6098] of the ungodly,[H7563] nor standeth[H5975] in the way[H1870] of sinners,[H2400] nor sitteth[H3427] in the seat[H4186] of the scornful.
But his delight[H2656] is in the law[H8451] of the LORD;[H3068] and in his law[H8451] doth he meditate[H1897] day[H3119] and night.

And he shall be like a tree[H6086] planted[H8362] by the rivers[H6388] of water,[H4325] that bringeth forth[H5414] his fruit[H6529] in his season;[H6256] his leaf[H5929] also shall not wither;[H5034] and whatsoever he doeth[H6213] shall prosper.
The ungodly[H7563] are not so: but are like the chaff[H4671] which the wind[H7307] driveth away.
Therefore the ungodly[H7563] shall not stand[H6965] in the judgment,[H4941] nor sinners[H2400] in the congregation[H5712] of the righteous.
For the LORD[H3068] knoweth[H3045] the way[H1870] of the righteous:[H6662] but the way[H1870] of the ungodly[H7563] shall perish.
Why do the heathen[H1471] rage,[H7283] and the people[H3816] imagine[H1897] a vain thing?
The kings[H4428] of the earth[H776] set[H3320] themselves, and the rulers[H7336] take counsel[H3245] together,[H3162] against the LORD,[H3068] and against his anointed,
Let us break[H5423] their bands[H4147] asunder,[H5423] and cast away[H7993] their cords
He that sitteth[H3427] in the heavens[H8064] shall laugh:[H7832] the Lord[H136] shall have them in derision.
Then shall he speak[H1696] unto them in his wrath,[H639] and vex[H926] them in his sore displeasure.
Yet have I set[H5258] my king[H4428] upon my holy[H6944] hill[H2022] of Zion.
I will declare[H5608] the decree:[H2706] the LORD[H3068] hath said[H559] unto me, Thou art my Son;[H1121] this day[H3117] have I begotten
Ask[H7592] of me, and I shall give[H5414] thee the heathen[H1471] for thine inheritance,[H5159] and the uttermost parts[H657] of the earth[H776] for thy possession.
Thou shalt break[H7489] them with a rod[H7626] of iron;[H1270] thou shalt dash them in pieces[H5310] like a potter's[H3335] vessel.
Be wise[H7919] now therefore, O ye kings:[H4428] be instructed,[H3256] ye judges[H8199] of the earth.
Serve[H5647] the LORD[H3068] with fear,[H3374] and rejoice[H1523] with trembling.
Kiss[H5401] the Son,[H1248] lest he be angry,[H599] and ye perish[H6] from the way,[H1870] when his wrath[H639] is kindled[H1197] but a little.[H4592] Blessed[H835] are all they that put their trust
[[A Psalm[H4210] of David,[H1732] when he fled[H1272] from[H6440] Absalom[H53] his son.]][H1121] LORD,[H3068] how are they increased[H7231] that trouble[H6862] me! many[H7227] are they that rise up
Many[H7227] there be which say[H559] of my soul,[H5315] There is no help[H3444] for him in God.[H430] Selah.
But thou, O LORD,[H3068] art a shield[H4043] for me; my glory,[H3519] and the lifter up[H7311] of mine head.
I cried[H7121] unto the LORD[H3068] with my voice,[H6963] and he heard[H6030] me out of his holy[H6944] hill.[H2022] Selah.
I laid me down[H7901] and slept;[H3462] I awaked;[H6974] for the LORD[H3068] sustained
I will not be afraid[H3372] of ten thousands[H7233] of people,[H5971] that have set[H7896] themselves against me round about.
Arise,[H6965] O LORD;[H3068] save[H3467] me, O my God:[H430] for thou hast smitten[H5221] all mine enemies[H341] upon the cheek bone;[H3895] thou hast broken[H7665] the teeth[H8127] of the ungodly.
Salvation[H3444] belongeth unto the LORD:[H3068] thy blessing[H1293] is upon thy people.[H5971] Selah.

[[To the chief Musician[H5329] on Neginoth,[H5058] A Psalm[H4210] of David.]][H1732] Hear[H6030] me when I call,[H7121] O God[H430] of my righteousness:[H6664] thou hast enlarged[H7337] me when I was in distress;[H6862] have mercy[H2603] upon me, and hear[H8085] my prayer.
O ye sons[H1121] of men,[H376] how long[H5704] will ye turn my glory[H3519] into shame?[H3639] how long will ye love[H157] vanity,[H7385] and seek[H1245] after leasing?[H3577] Selah.
But know[H3045] that the LORD[H3068] hath set apart[H6395] him that is godly[H2623] for himself: the LORD[H3068] will hear[H8085] when I call
Stand in awe,[H7264] and sin[H2398] not: commune[H559] with your own heart[H3824] upon your bed,[H4904] and be still.[H1826] Selah.
Offer[H2076] the sacrifices[H2077] of righteousness,[H6664] and put your trust[H982] in the LORD.
There be many[H7227] that say,[H559] Who will shew[H7200] us any good?[H2896] LORD,[H3068] lift thou up[H5375] the light[H216] of thy countenance
Thou hast put[H5414] gladness[H8057] in my heart,[H3820] more than in the time[H6256] that their corn[H1715] and their wine[H8492] increased.
I will both[H3162] lay me down[H7901] in peace,[H7965] and sleep:[H3462] for thou, LORD,[H3068] only[H910] makest me dwell[H3427] in safety.
[[To the chief Musician[H5329] upon Nehiloth,[H5155] A Psalm[H4210] of David.]][H1732] Give ear[H238] to my words,[H561] O LORD,[H3068] consider[H995] my meditation.
Hearken[H7181] unto the voice[H6963] of my cry,[H7773] my King,[H4428] and my God:[H430] for unto thee will I pray.
My voice[H6963] shalt thou hear[H8085] in the morning,[H1242] O LORD;[H3068] in the morning[H1242] will I direct[H6186] my prayer unto thee, and will look up.
For thou art not a God[H410] that hath pleasure[H2655] in wickedness:[H7562] neither shall evil[H7451] dwell
The foolish[H1984] shall not stand[H3320] in thy sight:[H5869] thou hatest[H8130] all workers[H6466] of iniquity.
Thou shalt destroy[H6] them that speak[H1696] leasing:[H3577] the LORD[H3068] will abhor[H8581] the bloody[H1818] and deceitful[H4820] man.
But as for me, I will come[H935] into thy house[H1004] in the multitude[H7230] of thy mercy:[H2617] and in thy fear[H3374] will I worship[H7812] toward thy holy[H6944] temple.
Lead[H5148] me, O LORD,[H3068] in thy righteousness[H6666] because of mine enemies;[H8324] make thy way[H1870] straight[H3474] before my face.

For there is no faithfulness[H3559] in their mouth;[H6310] their inward[H7130] part is very wickedness;[H1942] their throat[H1627] is an open[H6605] sepulchre;[H6913] they flatter[H2505] with their tongue.
Destroy[H816] thou them, O God;[H430] let them fall[H5307] by their own counsels;[H4156] cast them out[H5080] in the multitude[H7230] of their transgressions;[H6588] for they have rebelled

But let all those that put their trust[H2620] in thee rejoice:[H8055] let them ever[H5769] shout for joy,[H7442] because thou defendest[H5526] them: let them also that love[H157] thy name[H8034] be joyful
For thou, LORD,[H3068] wilt bless[H1288] the righteous;[H6662] with favour[H7522] wilt thou compass[H5849] him as with a shield.

[[To the chief Musician[H5329] on Neginoth[H5058] upon Sheminith,[H8067] A Psalm[H4210] of David.]][H1732] O LORD,[H3068] rebuke[H3198] me not in thine anger,[H639] neither chasten[H3256] me in thy hot displeasure.
Have mercy[H2603] upon me, O LORD;[H3068] for I am weak:[H536] O LORD,[H3068] heal[H7495] me; for my bones[H6106] are vexed.
My soul[H5315] is also sore[H3966] vexed:[H926] but thou, O LORD,
Return,[H7725] O LORD,[H3068] deliver[H2502] my soul:[H5315] oh save[H3467] me for thy mercies'
For in death[H4194] there is no remembrance[H2143] of thee: in the grave[H7585] who shall give thee thanks?
I am weary[H3021] with my groaning;[H585] all the night[H3915] make I my bed[H4296] to swim;[H7811] I water[H4529] my couch[H6210] with my tears.
Mine eye[H5869] is consumed[H6244] because of grief;[H3708] it waxeth old[H6275] because of all mine enemies.
Depart[H5493] from me, all ye workers[H6466] of iniquity;[H205] for the LORD[H3068] hath heard[H8085] the voice[H6963] of my weeping.
The LORD[H3068] hath heard[H8085] my supplication;[H8467] the LORD[H3068] will receive[H3947] my prayer.
Let all mine enemies[H341] be ashamed[H954] and sore[H3966] vexed:[H926] let them return[H7725] and be ashamed[H954] suddenly.

[[Shiggaion[H7692] of David,[H1732] which he sang[H7891] unto the LORD,[H3068] concerning the words[H1697] of Cush[H3568] the Benjamite.]][H1121][H1145] O LORD[H3068] my God,[H430] in thee do I put my trust:[H2620] save[H3467] me from all them that persecute[H7291] me, and deliver
Lest he tear[H2963] my soul[H5315] like a lion,[H738] rending it in pieces,[H6561] while there is none to deliver.
O LORD[H3068] my God,[H430] if I have done[H6213] this; if there be[H3426] iniquity[H5766] in my hands;
If I have rewarded[H1580] evil[H7451] unto him that was at peace[H7999] with me; (yea, I have delivered[H2502] him that without cause[H7387] is mine enemy:)

Let the enemy[H341] persecute[H7291] my soul,[H5315] and take[H5381] it; yea, let him tread down[H7429] my life[H2416] upon the earth,[H776] and lay[H7931] mine honour[H3519] in the dust.[H6083] Selah.
Arise,[H6965] O LORD,[H3068] in thine anger,[H639] lift up[H5375] thyself because of the rage[H5678] of mine enemies:[H6887] and awake[H5782] for me to the judgment[H4941] that thou hast commanded.
So shall the congregation[H5712] of the people[H3816] compass thee about:[H5437] for their sakes therefore return[H7725] thou on high.
The LORD[H3068] shall judge[H1777] the people:[H5971] judge[H8199] me, O LORD,[H3068] according to my righteousness,[H6664] and according to mine integrity
Oh let the wickedness[H7451] of the wicked[H7563] come to an end;[H1584] but establish[H3559] the just:[H6662] for the righteous[H6662] God[H430] trieth[H974] the hearts[H3826] and reins.
My defence[H4043] is of God,[H430] which saveth[H3467] the upright[H3477] in heart.
God[H430] judgeth[H8199] the righteous,[H6662] and God[H410] is angry[H2194] with the wicked every day.
If he turn[H7725] not, he will whet[H3913] his sword;[H2719] he hath bent[H1869] his bow,[H7198] and made it ready.
He hath also prepared[H3559] for him the instruments[H3627] of death;[H4194] he ordaineth[H6466] his arrows[H2671] against the persecutors.
Behold, he travaileth[H2254] with iniquity,[H205] and hath conceived[H2029] mischief,[H5999] and brought forth[H3205] falsehood.
He made[H3738] a pit,[H953] and digged[H2658] it, and is fallen[H5307] into the ditch[H7845] which he made.
His mischief[H5999] shall return[H7725] upon his own head,[H7218] and his violent[H2555] dealing shall come down[H3381] upon his own pate.
I will praise[H3034] the LORD[H3068] according to his righteousness:[H6664] and will sing praise[H2167] to the name[H8034] of the LORD[H3068] most high.

[[To the chief Musician[H5329] upon Gittith,[H1665] A Psalm[H4210] of David.]][H1732] O LORD[H3068] our Lord,[H113] how excellent[H117] is thy name[H8034] in all the earth![H776] who hast set[H5414] thy glory[H1935] above the heavens.

Out of the mouth[H6310] of babes[H5768] and sucklings[H3243] hast thou ordained[H3245] strength[H5797] because of thine enemies,[H6887] that thou mightest still[H7673] the enemy[H341] and the avenger.
When I consider[H7200] thy heavens,[H8064] the work[H4639] of thy fingers,[H676] the moon[H3394] and the stars,[H3556] which thou hast ordained;
What is man,[H582] that thou art mindful[H2142] of him? and the son[H1121] of man,[H120] that thou visitest
For thou hast made him a little[H4592] lower[H2637] than the angels,[H430] and hast crowned[H5849] him with glory[H3519] and honour.
Thou madest him to have dominion[H4910] over the works[H4639] of thy hands;[H3027] thou hast put[H7896] all things under his feet:
All sheep[H6792] and oxen,[H504] yea, and the beasts[H929] of the field;
The fowl[H6833] of the air,[H8064] and the fish[H1709] of the sea,[H3220] and whatsoever passeth through[H5674] the paths[H734] of the seas.
O LORD[H3068] our Lord,[H113] how excellent[H117] is thy name[H8034] in all the earth!

[[To the chief Musician[H5329] upon Muthlabben,[H4192][H1121] A Psalm[H4210] of David.]][H1732] I will praise[H3034] thee, O LORD,[H3068] with my whole heart;[H3820] I will shew forth[H5608] all thy marvellous works.
I will be glad[H8055] and rejoice[H5970] in thee: I will sing praise[H2167] to thy name,[H8034] O thou most High.
When mine enemies[H341] are turned[H7725] back,[H268] they shall fall[H3782] and perish[H6] at thy presence.
For thou hast maintained[H6213] my right[H4941] and my cause;[H1779] thou satest[H3427] in the throne[H3678] judging[H8199] right.
Thou hast rebuked[H1605] the heathen,[H1471] thou hast destroyed[H6] the wicked,[H7563] thou hast put out[H4229] their name[H8034] for ever[H5769] and ever.
O thou enemy,[H341] destructions[H2723] are come to a perpetual[H5331] end:[H8552] and thou hast destroyed[H5428] cities;[H6145][H5892] their memorial[H2143] is perished[H6] with them.
But the LORD[H3068] shall endure[H3427] for ever:[H5769] he hath prepared[H3559] his throne[H3678] for judgment.
And he shall judge[H8199] the world[H8398] in righteousness,[H6664] he shall minister judgment[H1777] to the people[H3816] in uprightness.
The LORD[H3068] also will be a refuge[H4869] for the oppressed,[H1790] a refuge[H4869] in times[H6256] of trouble.
And they that know[H3045] thy name[H8034] will put their trust[H982] in thee: for thou, LORD,[H3068] hast not forsaken[H5800] them that seek
Sing praises[H2167] to the LORD,[H3068] which dwelleth[H3427] in Zion:[H6726] declare[H5046] among the people[H5971] his doings.
When he maketh inquisition[H1875] for blood,[H1818] he remembereth[H2142] them: he forgetteth[H7911] not the cry[H6818] of the humble.[H6035]
Have mercy[H2603] upon me, O LORD;[H3068] consider[H7200] my trouble[H6040] which I suffer of them that hate[H8130] me, thou that liftest me up[H7311] from the gates[H8179] of death:
That I may shew forth[H5608] all thy praise[H8416] in the gates[H8179] of the daughter[H1323] of Zion:[H6726] I will rejoice[H1523] in thy salvation.
The heathen[H1471] are sunk down[H2883] in the pit[H7845] that they made:[H6213] in the net[H7568] which[H2098] they hid[H2934] is their own foot[H7272] taken.
The LORD[H3068] is known[H3045] by the judgment[H4941] which he executeth:[H6213] the wicked[H7563] is snared[H5367] in the work[H6467] of his own hands.[H3709] Higgaion.[H1902] Selah.
The wicked[H7563] shall be turned[H7725] into hell,[H7585] and all the nations[H1471] that forget[H7913] God.
For the needy[H34] shall not alway[H5331] be forgotten:[H7911] the expectation[H8615] of the poor[H6041][H6035] shall not perish[H6] for ever.
Arise,[H6965] O LORD;[H3068] let not man[H582] prevail:[H5810] let the heathen[H1471] be judged[H8199] in thy sight.
Put[H7896] them in fear,[H4172][H4172] O LORD:[H3068] that the nations[H1471] may know[H3045] themselves to be but men.[H582] Selah.
Why standest[H5975] thou afar off,[H7350] O LORD?[H3068] why hidest[H5956] thou thyself in times[H6256] of trouble?
The wicked[H7563] in his pride[H1346] doth persecute[H1814] the poor:[H6041] let them be taken[H8610] in the devices[H4209] that[H2098] they have imagined.
For the wicked[H7563] boasteth[H1984] of his heart's[H5315] desire,[H8378] and blesseth[H1288] the covetous,[H1214] whom the LORD[H3068] abhorreth.
The wicked,[H7563] through the pride[H1363] of his countenance,[H639] will not seek[H1875] after God: God[H430] is not in all his thoughts.
His ways[H1870] are always[H6256] grievous;[H2342] thy judgments[H4941] are far above[H4791] out of his sight: as for all his enemies,[H6887] he puffeth
He hath said[H559] in his heart,[H3820] I shall not be moved:[H4131] for I shall never[H1755][H1755] be in adversity.
His mouth[H6310] is full[H4390] of cursing[H423] and deceit[H4820] and fraud:[H8496] under his tongue[H3956] is mischief[H5999] and vanity.
He sitteth[H3427] in the lurking places[H3993] of the villages:[H2691] in the secret places[H4565] doth he murder[H2026] the innocent:[H5355] his eyes[H5869] are privily set[H6845] against the poor.

He lieth in wait[H693] secretly[H4565] as a lion[H738] in his den:[H5520] he lieth in wait[H693] to catch[H2414] the poor:[H6041] he doth catch[H2414] the poor,[H6041] when he draweth[H4900] him into his net.
He croucheth,[H1794] and humbleth[H7817] himself, that the poor[H2426][H2489] may fall[H5307] by his strong ones.
He hath said[H559] in his heart,[H3820] God[H410] hath forgotten:[H7911] he hideth[H5641] his face;[H6440] he will never[H5331] see
Arise,[H6965] O LORD;[H3068] O God,[H410] lift up[H5375] thine hand:[H3027] forget[H7911] not the humble.[H6035]
Wherefore doth the wicked[H7563] contemn[H5006] God?[H430] he hath said[H559] in his heart,[H3820] Thou wilt not require

Thou hast seen[H7200] it; for thou beholdest[H5027] mischief[H5999] and spite,[H3708] to requite[H5414] it with thy hand:[H3027] the poor[H2489] committeth[H5800] himself unto thee; thou art the helper[H5826] of the fatherless.
Break[H7665] thou the arm[H2220] of the wicked[H7563] and the evil[H7451] man: seek out[H1875] his wickedness[H7562] till thou find[H4672] none.
The LORD[H3068] is King[H4428] for ever[H5769] and ever:[H5703] the heathen[H1471] are perished[H6] out of his land.
LORD,[H3068] thou hast heard[H8085] the desire[H8378] of the humble:[H6035] thou wilt prepare[H3559] their heart,[H3820] thou wilt cause thine ear[H241] to hear:
To judge[H8199] the fatherless[H3490] and the oppressed,[H1790] that the man[H582] of the earth[H776] may no more[H3254] oppress.
[[To the chief Musician,[H5329] A Psalm of David.]][H1732] In the LORD[H3068] put I my trust:[H2620] how say[H559] ye to my soul,[H5315] Flee[H5110] as a bird[H6833] to your mountain?

For, lo, the wicked[H7563] bend[H1869] their bow,[H7198] they make ready[H3559] their arrow[H2671] upon the string,[H3499] that they may privily[H652][H1119] shoot[H3384] at the upright[H3477] in heart.
If the foundations[H8356] be destroyed,[H2040] what can the righteous[H6662] do?
The LORD[H3068] is in his holy[H6944] temple,[H1964] the LORD'S[H3068] throne[H3678] is in heaven:[H8064] his eyes[H5869] behold,[H2372] his eyelids[H6079] try,[H974] the children[H1121] of men.
The LORD[H3068] trieth[H974] the righteous:[H6662] but the wicked[H7563] and him that loveth[H157] violence[H2555] his soul[H5315] hateth.
Upon the wicked[H7563] he shall rain[H4305] snares,[H6341] fire[H784] and brimstone,[H1614] and an horrible[H2152] tempest:[H7307] this shall be the portion[H4521] of their cup.
For the righteous[H6662] LORD[H3068] loveth[H157] righteousness;[H6666] his countenance[H6440] doth behold[H2372] the upright.

[[To the chief Musician[H5329] upon Sheminith,[H8067] A Psalm[H4210] of David.]][H1732] Help,[H3467] LORD;[H3068] for the godly man[H2623] ceaseth;[H1584] for the faithful[H539] fail[H6461] from among the children[H1121] of men.
They speak[H1696] vanity[H7723] every one[H376] with his neighbour:[H7453] with flattering[H2513] lips[H8193] and with a double[H3820] heart[H3820] do they speak.
The LORD[H3068] shall cut off[H3772] all flattering[H2513] lips,[H8193] and the tongue[H3956] that speaketh[H1696] proud
Who have said,[H559] With our tongue[H3956] will we prevail;[H1396] our lips[H8193] are our own: who is lord

For the oppression[H7701] of the poor,[H6041] for the sighing[H603] of the needy,[H34] now will I arise,[H6965] saith[H559] the LORD;[H3068] I will set[H7896] him in safety[H3468] from him that puffeth
The words[H565] of the LORD[H3068] are pure[H2889] words:[H565] as silver[H3701] tried[H6884] in a furnace[H5948] of earth,[H776] purified[H2212] seven times.
Thou shalt keep[H8104] them, O LORD,[H3068] thou shalt preserve[H5341] them from this[H2098] generation[H1755] for ever.
The wicked[H7563] walk[H1980] on every side,[H5439] when the vilest[H2149] men[H1121][H120] are exalted.
[[To the chief Musician,[H5329] A Psalm[H4210] of David.]][H1732] How long wilt thou forget[H7911] me, O LORD?[H3068] for ever?[H5331] how long wilt thou hide[H5641] thy face
How long shall I take[H7896] counsel[H6098] in my soul,[H5315] having sorrow[H3015] in my heart[H3824] daily?[H3119] how long shall mine enemy[H341] be exalted
Consider[H5027] and hear[H6030] me, O LORD[H3068] my God:[H430] lighten[H215] mine eyes,[H5869] lest I sleep[H3462] the sleep of death;
Lest mine enemy[H341] say,[H559] I have prevailed[H3201] against him; and those that trouble[H6862] me rejoice[H1523] when I am moved.
But I have trusted[H982] in thy mercy;[H2617] my heart[H3820] shall rejoice[H1523] in thy salvation.
I will sing[H7891] unto the LORD,[H3068] because he hath dealt bountifully

[[To the chief Musician,[H5329] A Psalm of David.]][H1732] The fool[H5036] hath said[H559] in his heart,[H3820] There is no God.[H430] They are corrupt,[H7843] they have done abominable[H8581] works,[H5949] there is none that doeth[H6213] good.
The LORD[H3068] looked down[H8259] from heaven[H8064] upon the children[H1121] of men,[H120] to see[H7200] if there[H3426] were any that did understand,[H7919] and seek[H1875] God.
They are all gone aside,[H5493] they are all together[H3162] become filthy:[H444] there is none that doeth[H6213] good,[H2896] no, not one.
Have all the workers[H6466] of iniquity[H205] no knowledge?[H3045] who eat up[H398] my people[H5971] as they eat[H398] bread,[H3899] and call[H7121] not upon the LORD.
